What it is

â€œWin Your Day with Breakfastâ€ is about front-loading your morning with 25â€“30g of protein so your body and hair have steady fuel. A balanced, quick meal anchors your energy and lowers inflammation before the day takes over.

Why this practice matters for you now

Pietra, youâ€™re in the stabilization phase â€” shedding is still high, but the worst wave has already crested. Right now, your body is asking for steady building blocks. Since youâ€™ve been averaging only one high-protein meal and navigating stress plus hormone shifts, this breakfast anchor is your big domino: it smooths stress hormones early and gives your follicles the raw material to shift toward regrowth in the coming months.

Step-by-step implementation

  1. Choose a protein base: 2 scrambled eggs + veggies, or a vegan smoothie with pea protein.
  2. Add healthy fats for satiety: avocado slices, chia seeds, or a spoon of nut butter.
  3. Round out with fiber: berries, spinach, or whole oats.
  4. Prep evening before if mornings are rushed â€” overnight oats or portioned smoothie bags work beautifully.

What to look for

  • Early wins: More even energy through the morning without crashing mid-day; fewer intense sugar cravings; steadier mood within 1â€“2 weeks.
  • Watch-outs: Skipping breakfast when stress feels heavy â€” quick fix: keep a 30g protein shake ready-to-go so you never miss the anchor.
  • Consistency builds momentum â€” one strong breakfast can truly reset your day and give your follicles the calm, steady fuel they need. ğŸŒ±
week3.practice2_html:
What it is

The Popeye Protocol is a simple set of food shifts designed to increase your iron intake and make sure your body can actually absorb it. When your cells have enough iron, your hair gets the fuel it needs to restart growth.

Why this practice matters for you now

Pietra, youâ€™ve shared that youâ€™ve had low iron before, and right now youâ€™re in the stabilization phase â€” the shedding has been rough, but the sharpest drop has already passed. Iron is your â€œbig dominoâ€: without it, follicles stay stuck; with it, they can reawaken. Strengthening your iron intake now positions your body for regrowth in early 2026, even with ongoing stress in the background.

Step-by-step implementation

  1. Choose one ironâ€‘rich food daily: spinach, lentils, red meat, pumpkin seeds, or chickpeas.
  2. Pair that food with a vitamin C source (like bell peppers, citrus, or strawberries) at the same meal to boost absorption.
  3. Avoid tea, coffee, or highâ€‘calcium dairy within 1â€“2 hours of your ironâ€‘rich meal â€” they block absorption.
  4. Track how often you hit this combo in a notebook or phone note; celebrate 4+ ironâ€‘focused meals by weekâ€™s end.

What to look for

  • Early wins: steadier energy through your afternoons, fewer dizzy/lightheaded spells, and more consistent warmth in hands and feet within 1â€“2 weeks.
  • Watch-outs: Skipping protein at breakfast (you mentioned most days are low in protein) â€” quick fix: add an egg, Greek yogurt, or a scoop of beans at your first meal.
  • Consistency builds momentum â€” each ironâ€‘rich plate is a quiet nudge toward your follicles waking up again. ğŸŒ±
week3.practice3_html:
What it is

â€œEat More Good Fatsâ€ is about giving your body steady omegaâ€‘3s â€” the kind of fats that calm inflammation and support healthy follicles from the inside out.

Why this practice matters for you now

Pietra, youâ€™re in the stabilization phase, where your shedding has started to level but your scalp is still waiting for a calmer internal signal before regrowth takes off. With your history of chronic stress and low intake of omegaâ€‘3s, this is the lever that can soften inflammation and prepare your follicles to shift from survival back to growth. Think of it as laying fertile ground before the sprouts return.

Step-by-step implementation

  1. Add one reliable source of omegaâ€‘3s daily: fatty fish (like salmon, sardines, mackerel), or an algaeâ€‘based supplement if you avoid fish.
  2. Pair your omegaâ€‘3s with protein at a meal (for example: salmon with eggs or tofu) to improve absorption and satiety.
  3. If supplementing, choose a product that lists both EPA and DHA amounts and check it smells fresh (no â€œfishy burpâ€ should linger).
  4. Aim for consistency: small daily doses work far better than an occasional large one.

What to look for

  • Early wins: Within 2 weeks, you may notice less scalp dryness or flaking; your energy and focus after meals can feel steadier; some women also see skin glow improve first, which is a sign your body is using these fats well.
  • Watch-outs: Given your lateâ€‘day caffeine habit, pairing omegaâ€‘3 with a late meal might keep your digestion active near bedtime. Quick fix: take it with lunch or an earlier dinner instead.
  • Consistency builds momentum â€” each daily dose is like watering the soil that will soon let your baby hairs break through. ğŸŒ±
